ocr_results.text: CCP had revoked the right of peasants to withdraw from the cooperatives,begin
ning an era of compulsory collectivization thatwouldlast into the early198os.
The pressure of feeding a rapidly growing urban population placed considerable
strain on the early PRC government. Traditionally, it was the prosperous “rich
peasants”who had produced much of the surplus grain that eventually made its
way to the cities. Land Reform weakened this group, and the“poor peasants"
whodisplaced them proved muchless willing to sell.Afteryears of shortages.
